info.title: Aerospike Management Console
info.description: Aerospike Management Console is used to manage and monitor Aerospike Database Clusters.

get.description: Get AMC Server Version and Information

Get the list of user connections

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

post.description:
Register or Update a new connection for user

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

get.description:
Get the user connection

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

post.description:
Connect to the cluster and return the entity tree

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

delete.description:
Delete a connection

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

get.description:
Get a cluster's backups

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

post.description:
Create a backup for the cluster

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

get.description:
Get current backup that is in-progress

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

Get a backup

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

Returns the config of all the nodes in the cluster.

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

post.description:
Changes the config of the node.

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

get.description:
Return the cluster's entity tree

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

Query a cluster's indexes

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

parameters.name: includeStats
parameters.description: Index stats should be included in the results

post.description:
Save a index in the cluster

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

get.description:
Get a index

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

delete.description:
Drop a index from the cluster

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

get.description:
Returns the aggregate latency of the cluster namespaces for a given window of time. If From/To are not specified, the latest throughput will be returned.

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

Query a cluster's modules

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

post.description:
Save a module in the cluster

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

get.description:
Get a cluster's module

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

delete.description:
Drop a module from the cluster

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

get.description:
Query cluster's namespaces

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

Get a cluster's nodes

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

Returns the config of the node.

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

post.description:
Changes the config of the node.

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

get.description:
Returns the aggregate latency of the node namespaces for a given window of time. If From/To are not specified, the latest throughput will be returned.

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

Query a node's namespaces

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

Get a cluster's namespace

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

delete.description:
Drop a namespace from the cluster

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

get.description:
Returns the aggregate latency of the namespace for a given window of time. If From/To are not specified, the latest throughput will be returned.

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

Query a cluster's namespaces

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

Get a namespace's set

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

delete.description:
Drop a set from the cluster (Supported by Aerospike server versions v3.12+)

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

get.description:
Returns the aggregate throughput of the namespace for a given window of time. If From/To are not specified, the latest throughput will be returned.

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

Returns the aggregate throughput of the node namespaces for a given window of time. If From/To are not specified, the latest throughput will be returned.

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

post.description:
Create a restore for the cluster

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

get.description:
Get current restore that is in-progress

Required security scopes:
  * `api:enterprise`

Returns the aggregate throughput of the connection nodes for a given window of time. If From/To are not specified, the latest throughput will be returned.

Required security scopes:
  * `api:general`

Get the list of users

Required security scopes:
  * `api:admin`

post.description:
Register or Update a new user

Required security scopes:
  * `api:admin`

get.description:
Get the list of users

Required security scopes:
  * `api:admin`

delete.description:
Delete a user

Required security scopes:
  * `api:admin`

createDate.description: The date when the backup was created

destinationAddress.description: Host on which the backup was created
destinationAddress.example: Tenetur magnam delectus aut voluptas commodi.

destinationPath.description: Directory where the backup was created
destinationPath.example: Similique ab amet enim et illo voluptatem.

error.description: Error message in case the backup was not successful

finishDate.description: The date when the backup was finished

metadataOnly.description: Indicated whether the backup was created only for the metadata

scanPriority.description: Prioity of the scan reading the data for the backup

sets.description: Sets from which backup was created

status.example: Ut laborum cupiditate modi dolorum hic.

terminateOnClusterChange.description: Indicates whether the backup was supposed to be terminated in case the cluster experienced a change in its nodes

IgnoreGenerationNumber.description: Indicates whether the restore should only update records with smaller generation number

MissingRecordsOnly.description: Indicates whether to restore records which do not exist on the cluster only

createDate.description: The date when the restore was created

error.description: Error message in case the restore was not successful

finishDate.description: The date when the restore was finished

sourceAddress.description: Host on which the backup file is located

sourcePath.description: Host on which the backup file is located

status.example: Minima animi distinctio ullam laudantium rem voluptas.

example.status: Minima animi distinctio ullam laudantium rem voluptas.

items.example: Provident ea nulla aut corrupti facilis est.

latestVersion.description: Latest server version used in the cluster

versionList.description: Map of server versions to nodes

user.description: AMC User Name (this is not the same as Database user name)

destinationAddress.description: Host on which the backup was created

destinationPath.description: Directory where the backup was created

metadataOnly.description: Indicated whether the backup was created only for the metadata

scanPriority.description: Prioity of the scan reading the data for the backup. 0 (auto), 1 (low), 2 (medium), 3 (high).

sets.description: Sets from which backup was created

terminateOnClusterChange.description: Indicates whether the backup was supposed to be terminated in case the cluster experienced a change in its nodes

IgnoreGenerationNumber.description: Indicates whether the restore should only update records with smaller generation number

MissingRecordsOnly.description: Indicates whether to restore records which do not exist on the cluster only

sourceAddress.description: Host on which the backup file is located

sourcePath.description: Host on which the backup file is located

host.description: Node Host. Valid DNS, IPv4 or IPv6 value

connectOnLogin.description: Should AMC connect to this cluster automatically after user login?

roles.description: Valid roles are: admin, ops, dev

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: Value of ID must be an integer

id.description: a unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about the error.

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

example.detail: Value of ID must be an integer

**Security Scopes**:
  * `api:cluster`: API access to cluster resources
